Con respecto a su antecesor, Portal 2 eleva el estándar de calidad de la saga simplemente porque su valor como videojuego es equivalente al de Portal, que es uno de los más aclamados de todos los tiempos. 
Pese a sus defectos, la segunda aventura de Chell en Aperture Science es una obra maestra con honores. Quizá la historia no es precisamente el punto fuerte del conjunto, sino que le trae más de un quebradero de cabeza, pero ello se explica porque, al ser Portal 2 mucho más ambicioso que Portal, su margen de error aumenta. Por lo demás, el presente título alcanza con facilidad los increíbles méritos de la obra de 2007 y logra los suyos propios. Todos sobresalientes.
Portal es una saga hiperrecomendable. Como su predecesor, Portal 2 no es un videojuego ultrasencillo pero sí uno accesible, ante todo original, muy divertido y que requiere de la atención total del usuario.

portal 2 es el segundo videojuego de valve corporation, una empresa estadounidense de los mas grandes juegos que podrian salir en esta realidad existencial.
uff que decir de este juego, aun no se por donde empezar pero lo intentare
aunque tecnicamente aun no lo he jugado y solo estuve en el menu del juego 5 minutos pero mis horas de rick and morty me permiten enterder y valorar este juego mas alla de lo superferficial.  lo recomiendo encarecidamente a las personas que le gustan los libros de paulo coelho y las peliculas del perfeccionista y asombroso stanley kubrick

Portal 2 is an amazing step-up from the previous game.
It feels better to play and the story is far, far better. If you ever played Portal you know that's not something one should say lightly, and if you havent played Portal, I highly recomend that you do, not just because it's one of the best games I've ever played, but because to truly apreciate the story.
And the story is amazing, tryinhg not to spoil anything for thoses lucky enough to come in without any idea of what's to come, it's a lot richer that Portal. That's because of two things: 
1)The game is bigger. Whilst it took me only 3-4 hours to beat Portal, it took me about 6-7 hours to beat Portal 2.
2) It has an amazing narrative. The creators claerly loved this game and it's obvious the had a blast making it. The simple solve this puzzle narrative of the begining of Portal is gone. The entire game feels like the end stage of it's predessesor. It's an emotional engaging story with well layed out twists and turns that'll amke you want to finish the game in one sitting.
The story follows Chel, the protagonist of the prvious game, as she tries to find her way out of Apeture. Along the way she encounter amazing character, new and old, alies and foes that will help and hinder her escape, forcing farther and farther into the deapts of Apeture. With secrets and questions at every turn, it's up to her to find her way out.
The mechanics of this game are also an amazing step-up from the prvious game. Portal had some of the best physics of it's time, but Portal 2 (as expected form a later generation game) has it beat. If you ever played Portal (and I recomend that you do before playing Portal 2) you probabily had a blast, the puzzles are amazing and it handles like a charm. Portal 2's puzzles feel much the same, challenging yet well within reason, making it a very good experience. The better physics of the game also help with that. Replaying Portal after Portal 2 made me see just how much the sequel improved the original, as part of the challenge, for me at least, came form controling the character as well as the puzzle. With Portal 2, that issue disapears.
When you add the amazing story with the great mechanics, you get a game that you'll want to replay even though you already know how to solve the puzzles, which never stop being fun. I've played 5 times by the time I wrote this, and I can assure I still have a few more to go before I put this one down for good.
Portal 2 is the quintessential puzzle game. If that's the type of game you like I highly recomend both this one and the previous.

[i]Portal 2[/i] is an expertly-crafted puzzle game. It's highly intuitive, inventive, and hilarious, often grimly hilarious! A few of the puzzles are too straightforward, while others have such an obtuse solution that I was sure the developers could have more clearly communicated what is possible with these mechanics. The game can be beaten in under 10 hours, but toward the end I felt it had been unnecessarily padded just a little, unlike the original game which is the perfect length. [i]Portal 2[/i] can be damn frustrating, but any good puzzle game is ultimately supposed to make the player feel clever, and when I discovered the solution to certain brainteasers, I was sure I was a genius.
